result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miles J Sinkey

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Miles J Sinkey in court.  Attorney Michael s Winter in court for Miles J Sinkey.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Review Hearing scheduled
Review hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.  rmm

Defendant Miles J Sinkey in court.  Attorney Michael s Winter in court for Miles J Sinkey.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Parties are pursuing a DPA resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Miles J Sinkey in court with Attorney Michael s Winter.   Abigail Doweiko, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 01.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Miles J Sinkey in court.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State allowing time for retained attorney to be present. Case is adjourned back to Out of Custody Court, Safety Building Room 221.
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-7-2022 @2:30p
